page.title: 06Yarm Buildings of Interest
page.content: 1{Bridge}_ Built in 1400. 2{Viaduct}_ One of the longest in England. 3{Town Hall}_ Built in 1710. 4{Atlas Skinnery}_ Sheep skins are treated here,tanning being a traditional industry. 5{Methodist Chapel}_ Only octagonal chapel still in use in England. 6{Dovecote}_ Late 16th century. 7{Ketton Ox}_ Built in the 17th. century.Cock fighting pit in loft. 8{George and Dragon}_ Connected with the start of the railway. 9 {Parish Church}_ Partly Norman. 10{Hope House}_ Oldest house. 11{Bentley House}_ Fine 18th century building. 12{The Friarage}_ Site of 13th century Dominican Friary,now a school. 13{Yarm Castle}_ In West Street !!!
